title: ICE with const_trait_impl and const_mut_refs and explicit lifetimes

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
#![feature(const_trait_impl, const_mut_refs)]
struct Foo<'a> { bar: &'a mut Vec<usize> }
impl<'a> Foo<'a> {
    const fn spam(&mut self, baz: &mut Vec<u32>) {
        self.bar[0] = baz.len();
    }
}
fn main() {}
```

Using:

```
rustc 1.61.0-nightly (c274e4969 2022-03-05)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: c274e4969f058b1c644243181ece9f829efa7594
commit-date: 2022-03-05
host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu
release: 1.61.0-nightly
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```



```rust
error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn `Vec::<u32>::len` in constant functions
 --> ...\test.rs:5:27
  |
5 |         self.bar[0] = baz.len();
  |                           ^^^^^
  |
  = note: calls in constant functions are limited to constant functions, tuple structs and tuple variants
